Kudos to our hard working students and highly skilled staff on these impressive results. #knightspride

October is National Bullying Prevention Month. Ways to help from PACER’s National Bullying Prevention Center include:
1. Talk with and listen to your child every day. Engage in frequent conversations about their social lives and ask open ended questions. Talk about what bullying is and the role of being a bystander.
2. Learn the signs. A child who is bullied often exhibits signs of physical distress and often does not want to go to school.
3. Report any bullying behavior to a school administrator---see STMA School Board Policy #514 Bullying Prohibition. #knightspride

post_text: October is National Bullying Prevention Month. Staff work hard throughout the year to ensure all students understand the expectations while at school. All school staff are regularly trained on what bullying is, what the district’s policies and expectations are, and what to do if they see bullying. Staff also teach through curricular lessons and by modeling appropriate behavior. When parents, school staff, and community members respond quickly and consistently to bullying behavior they send the message it is not acceptable. #knightspride

post_text: October is National Bullying Prevention Month. On Wednesday, October 23 the district observes Unity Day. Unity Day is a day where we join together to make a statement that that bullying behavior is not okay, to show support for students who have been bullied, and to continue the conversation about bullying prevention. Please join us as we wear orange on this day to send a universal message of support, hope, and unity. #knightspride
